Description: Goethite cylinder-seal; a kilted priest with forehead ornament, holding a cup and pail and standing on a two-tiered dais, and the robed king who raises one hand, faces the ascending sun god who rests his foot on a rectangular mountain beneath a star-disc and crescent; behind the god stands a goddess in a flounced robe, facing left and holding up a stick or rod. In the field, lightning fork; two cuneiform signs over erasure. Traces of a line border round the bottom of the seal; chipped.
Bibliographic references: Collon 1986a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals III: Isin-Larsa and Old Babylonian Periods (332)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.300)
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
